title: Aunt now caring for child of parents killed in Watertown murder-suicide
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Karine Asatryan and Nadia Abrahamian were killed by David Minasvand in a Watertown home in a murder-suicide.
Asatryan's 1-year-old daughter, Madeline, will be raised by her aunt following her parents' deaths.
A fundraiser supporting Madeline and honoring Karine Asatryan's memory has raised over $37,000 so far.

title: What Don Sweeney said about the Bruins’ playoff odds, timeline for new captain
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bruins GM Don Sweeney emphasized the team's competitiveness, focusing on health and a return to defensive identity for 2025-26.
The Bruins are relying on new signings and young talent, with prospects vying for key roles during training camp.
Sweeney announced the season will start without a captain, allowing leadership to develop naturally within the team.

title: These 5 New England restaurants make best 50 list from NYT
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Five New England restaurants made The New York Times' list of 50 best in the U.S., including two in Boston.
Boston's La Padrona and McGonagle's pub were recognized for Italian and Irish cuisine, respectively.
Connecticut's Haring's and Maine's Pilgrim's Inn and Sammy’s Deluxe were also featured on the NYT list.

title: Patriots reportedly cut ‘training camp star’ DJ James
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots waived cornerback DJ James after he stood out in preseason, says NFL Media's Tom Pelissero.
James played two defensive snaps and one tackle in the season opener against the Raiders, with limited action.
Patriots' cornerback depth affected by injuries to Christian Gonzalez and omission of Charles Woods in recent game.

title: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce may get married in Rhode Island. Here’s everything we know about the possible wedding plans.
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce may marry in Rhode Island by end of 2026, reports suggest.
Holiday House, Swift's 11,000-square-foot mansion in Westerly, R.I., is a potential wedding venue.
Swift and Kelce got engaged in August 2025; sources say a wedding might occur next summer.

title: 2 cyclists medflighted after Mass. crashes
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: A 63-year-old cyclist was medflighted with serious injuries after being struck by a car in Gloucester, Massachusetts.
In Norwood, a 15-year-old cyclist was medflighted with nonlife-threatening injuries after a crash on Walpole Street.
Both accidents are under investigation; neither driver faces charges at this time, according to local police.

title: North Andover officer shot by colleague released from jail
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: North Andover officer Kelsey Fitzsimmons released on personal recognizance, facing a charge of assault with a dangerous weapon.
Fitzsimmons prohibited from contacting her infant son, ordered to wear a GPS device, and remain under house arrest.
Incident stemmed from a confrontation with officers enforcing a restraining order; Fitzsimmons claims the gun was not aimed at anyone.

title: N.H. woman indicted for allegedly distributing ‘animal crush’ videos
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Lynn Seymour, 51, of Manchester, N.H., was indicted for allegedly distributing animal 'crush' videos and conspiring online.
Court documents indicate Seymour pleaded not guilty and was released under conditions including mental health treatment and limited internet use.
Seymour faces up to 12 years in prison and $500,000 in fines if convicted on all charges related to distributing harmful content.

title: Tom Brady talks Netflix roast, ‘most rewarding’ Super Bowl win on Kevin Hart’s ‘Cold as Balls’
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Tom Brady discussed his most rewarding Super Bowl win with Kevin Hart, choosing his Buccaneers victory as the highlight.
Brady reflected on his relationship with Bill Belichick during a recent Las Vegas event, emphasizing their great rapport.
Brady enjoyed his Netflix roast but noted it was hard on his children, expressing the value of laughter through tough times.

title: What issues are most important to you in the Boston mayoral, City Council election?
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Boston's preliminary elections on Sept. 9 will eliminate candidates, leading to the general election on Nov. 4.
Residents cite housing affordability, immigration, public safety, and infrastructure as critical issues in the mayoral election.
Voters express concerns over high rent, safety in Mass and Cass, and city resources for immigrants.
